name: Taco Salad Dip
author: Tanaquil
summary: I made this up with ingredients I had when I needed something to take to a Cinco de Mayo luncheon. It has the ingredients of a layered taco dip, but the addition of lettuce makes it like a salad. The best of both worlds!
ingredients: ½ (1 ounce) package taco seasoning mix
1 (1 ounce) package dry onion soup mix
¼ head iceberg lettuce, torn into bite-sized pieces
directions: Mix ranch-style beans and refried beans together in the bottom of a shallow casserole dish; season with   mix and stir
Spread the bean mixture into an even layer
Mix sour cream and onion soup mix together in a small bowl; spread over the bean mixture
Top the sour cream layer with salsa
Refrigerate dish until the bean layer firms, about 30 minutes
Sprinkle tortilla chips in a layer over the lettuce
Finish with a layer of Cheddar cheese
